dialogues.text: Carnegie is a practiced liar. Much more difficult to read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Redridge. He's kind of my right-hand man around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge - one of the two men who chased Eli into the roo steps forward. He regards Eli with a distrustful eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll show you to your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge opens the door and ushers Eli inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's another of the dressing rooms converted into a bedro less well-appointed than Carnegie's own. A threadbare rug Bed with relatively clean sheets. A sink for washing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your stay. There'll be someone outside your room all night. If you need anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge smirks and closes the door, leaving Eli alone. E paces across the room. Finally sits down on the creaky ol bed. Trying to figure out how he managed to get stuck her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unshoulders his pack, sets it down. Lies down on the b It's been a while since he felt a real bed on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK at the door. Eli gets quickly to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and CLAUDIA enters. Carrying a metal tub o water in both hands and, atop that, a dinner tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this for you. Water for washing and some food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli just stands there. Totally unfamiliar with this kind situation, it's been too long. She smiles, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... are you going to take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the stuff from her, sets it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get the impression that Claudia is as unfamiliar with kind of polite interaction as Eli. But she likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be dark soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She strikes a match and lights the oil lamp on the table. room is lit by its flickering glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Have a good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she turns for the door:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Carnegie's woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just making conversation is all. Haven't had one of those in a while. Not a real one, leastways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudia smiles. Neither has she.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found me in the outland. I was sixteen, my family had been... well, they were gone. There was just me and my baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd met some men on the road. Bad men. They...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. She trails off, struggling with this unhappy memory Eli gets it, raises a hand reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on the road for a year after that. I couldn't feed myself, let alone my little girl. And then Bill found us and he promised he'd take care of us. He told me he was going to make a place where we could be safe. And he did. He did all that. He built this whole town. He kept us safe. And he raised that child like she was his own. He's been so good to both of us. He saved us, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a bittersweet quality to Claudia's words. As thou there is more to the story than she is telling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli pulls out a chair at the table, offers it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to eat some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and sits. Eli sits across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you go blind? In the war? You get caught in a flash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was born this way. I think I'm lucky like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like I ever knew what I'm missing. I was already used to being like this by the time... by the time it all happened. So I got around pretty good even when I was on my own. And now it's easy. I know every creaky old floorboard in here, and it's not like I ever go any place else. Bill would never allow it. He worries about me so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, bittersweet. The sense that Claudia feels trapped. Thinking about it begins to upset her. She gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go. He'll be wondering where I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli stands, escorts her to the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I enjoyed our conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli closes the door, then sits back at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie washes, looking at himself in the old dressing-r mirror. He sees Claudia enter the room in its dim reflect

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took your time in there. How long does it take to deliver a plate of food and some water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A subtly accusing tone. It makes Claudia nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? What about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing really. He asked me what it was like to be blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tell you anything about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think he likes to talk about himself much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudia moves to the bedside, begins to undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he's going to change his mind by morning. I don't think he's going to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just strikes me as the kind of man who's of a mind, is all. Doesn't seem like the type to go changing it once it's set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll just see about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw him. He's not like the others. You won't be able to smooth- talk him and wrap him around your finger like you usually do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said anything about me? (BEAT) I'm sending Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudia reacts suddenly to this. Shocked and angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how often these walkers get laid? Never. Least not by anything living or willing. Girl like her can be very persuasive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't send her in there with him. He's dangerous, he's a killer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went in there readily enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's different. Solara's just a child, she can't-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie sighs, tiring of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a grown woman now, Claudia. Sooner or later you're going to have to accept that. She has to earn her keep around here, same as the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By working as a whore? That's all you think she's fit for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've each been given a talent to help us make our way in this world. Some people's gift is more evident than others. Solara's sure as hell is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudia looks at Carnegie in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a man are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's Carnegie's turn to get angry. He rounds on her menacingly. She backs off as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the kind of man who'd pull a helpless blind girl off the road, a girl who'd been beaten and raped, and give her a place where she can live without fear! Without me you'd be just another no-eye, lying dead in the outland, picked clean by the buzzards, or shoveling dirt down there with the others. That's the kind of man I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has her against the wall, his face just inches from he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't live without fear. I haven't for a long time now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie calms himself, backs off. Claudia goes to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to let you do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie surges forward and pins Claudia to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to let me? (BEAT) Nobody tells me what I can and can't do in my own town. Nobody. I built this world, and I am God here! So don't go thinking about screwing with my plans. You know how this works. Solara goes against me, you get hurt. You go against me, she gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He releases his grip on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's not see anybody get hurt. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He speaks more softly now. As he strokes his hand tenderl through Claudia's hair, a tear runs down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark outside, but the room is brightly lit by the glow of oil lamp. Eli sits up on his bed, quietly reading the old leather-bound book from his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another KNOCK at the door. Eli jumps up and hurriedly hid the book inside his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens to reveal Solara. Looking very different t she did before. Cleaned up and wearing a flowery summer dress, blonde hair let down over her shoulders. Stunning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlike everyone else we have met, she seems - physically, least - totally unscarred by the horrors of the times. Fa too beautiful a thing to belong in a world like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone was already here with food and water. I got everything I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glides into the room, closing the door. She's good. V seductive. Eli is totally disarmed in her presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too bright in here. Mind if I turn it down a little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't wait for an answer. Moves to the table and tu down the oil lamp. A darker, more seductive lighting sche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. I'm Solara. You're Walker, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. My name's Eli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That short for something? Elias?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah. I never heard that one before. It's kinda cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the bed, kicks her legs playfully. Her light cotton dress revealing in all the right places. The silhouette of her body bathed in the seductive glow of th oil lamp. No red-blooded man on earth could resist her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't mean to be rude. But I'm really not interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that? It gets mighty lonely out there on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans over on the bed, resting on her elbow. Her hair cascades down. God damn, she looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're worried about money, this is all paid for. The whole night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that. You're a very nice girl. But I'm not that kind of man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides off the bed, approaches him. Begins to work th buttons of his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all that kind of man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves her hand away. Gently pushes her back a step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is stunned. No man has ever turned her down before. A then she seems a little insulted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me you were crazy. Maybe they were right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli opens the door for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly all her other emotions give way to fear. She mov to the door and slams it shut again. Looks Eli in the eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't make me leave. I have to stay the night. If I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll hurt my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who will? Carnegie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, fighting back a tear. This angers Eli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he and I oughta have words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes for the door handle, but she stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Please, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hurting you. He's hurting your mother. He's-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Eli moves his hand away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if you want to help me, just let me stay here tonight. We don't have to do anything. I'll sleep on the floor. Tomorrow you can tell my dad that we had a good time. I'll be no trouble, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at Eli imploringly. Transformed. No longer t teenage sex kitten. Now she's just a frightened little gi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to have a conversation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, wiping the tear from her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara sit together on the bed. A silent BEAT. At first, it appears as though they have nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you don't have to be afraid of me. What happened down there in the bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of you. I know you didn't start that trouble. When I first saw you, I knew you weren't the type to go looking for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom says I'm a good judge of character. She says I can read people. That I know a good man when I see one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. Eli is surprised to find himself smiling back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... you're pretty old, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli smiles, amused by the bluntness of the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I just mean, I haven't seen too many people your age. How old are you exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I don't rightly remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're old enough. I mean, you remember what it was like? In the world before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli thinks about this. Dredging through old, old memories

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than this. (BEAT) People lived longer back then. Longer than me. Some were more than a hundred years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara smiles like she's having her leg pulled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, it's true. Nowadays it's not the same. If you're sick or you're weak or you're old you won't last long out on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how come you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Eli thinks. Should he or shouldn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I read you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. You can read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli pulls the book from his shirt. Solara's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have a book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just any book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time we see that it's a KING JAMES BIBLE. A embossed GOLD CROSS on its old leather cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli opens it up, scans the page with his finger until he finds the passage he's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord is my shepherd. I shall not want. He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters. He restores my soul. He leads me in the paths of righteousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SOLARA as she listens to Eli read. Transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil. For you are with me. Your rod and your staff, they comfort me. You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil. My cup runs over. Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me, all the days of my life. And I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's beautiful. Did you write that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What book is it from? Is it poetry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you could think of it that way. It's from the Holy Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never heard of it. What's it about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT as Eli thinks. How on earth to answer that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about love, and forgiveness, and life and death, and mercy, and revenge, and the beginning and the end of the world. I guess it's about a little bit of everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches out for the book but he snatches it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm not going to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm charged to protect this book. I can't trust it with anyone. Not even for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so special about that book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Eli runs his fingers across the embossed gold cross the beat-up leather cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the last one. There are no other books like this. All the others are gone - destroyed by the war or in the burnings that came after. This is the only one that survived until now. The last one anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just know. (BEAT) For a long while after it happened, I just wandered on the road like most everybody else. There were still a lot of people around back then, in the beginning. I didn't really know what I should do or where I was going. I was just moving from place to place, trying to stay alive. And then one day I heard this voice. I don't know how to explain it, it's like it was coming from inside me. But I could hear it, clear as day. Clear as I can hear you talking to me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It led me to this place, I don't really know where. And I found this book buried deep under some rubble. No way no-one was ever going to find it if they didn't know exactly where to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you knew because the voice told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. And that voice told me to carry the book west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (cont'd) It told me that a path would be laid out before me, that I'd be led to a place where this book would be safe. It told me I'd be protected against anyone or anything that tried to stand in my way. If only I would have faith. (BEAT) That was twenty-five years ago. And I've been walking ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SKEPTICAL) Because a voice you heard in your head told you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not crazy. I didn't imagine it. I know what I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who was it? The voice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT as Eli considers his answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very important, very powerful man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More powerful than my dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SMILES) I should say so, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. The two of them sit in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you teach me to read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never learned. No-one around here knows how. Only my dad, and he won't teach me. I think he likes being the only one who can read. I think it makes him feel powerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're probably right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So would you teach me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm leaving tomorrow. And I won't be back this way, ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down, sad. She likes this guy. She doesn't want to leave. Eli can sense her sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some food on the table over there. Let's eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over to where the dinner tray is covered by a s cloth. She whips it away - to reveal ELI'S RAT nibbling o piece of cheese. Solara SHRIEKS and backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rat scurries down the table leg and leaps up onto Eli shoulder, just as afraid of her as she is of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, it's okay. He's with me. (to the rat) Don't be afraid, pal. This is Solara. She's our friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara approaches warily. Reaches out and strokes him. Th rat scurries up her arm. She almost shrieks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It means he likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, if he didn't like you, you'd know about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara pets the rat on her shoulder. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really mean that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I'm your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Eli finds himself surprised that he admitted such a thing. When is the last time he had someone he could call friend? He can't even remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. Giggles as the rat's whiskers tickle her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli breaks the cheese in two and gives half to Solara. Sh about to eat but stops as Eli clasp his hands in prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our father, we thank you for this meal which you have been so gracious to place before us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsure of what to do, Solara mimics Eli, putting her hand together and bowing her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thank you for a warm bed and a roof over our heads on a cold night such as this. (BEAT) And we thank you for the gift of friendship in these hard times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara looks at him, touched by that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. (BEAT) You say that last part too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. And now we eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit and eat together, sharing the simple meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT from the window as they eat, away from the theat Away from the town and its flickering points of torchligh Moving farther and farther away until the entire town is consumed by the darkness of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pale sun rises over the town. To establish:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was once the theater's COSTUME ROOM - OLD MANNEQUINS still stand around in the corners, creating an eerie feel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie and Claudia sit at a DINING TABLE, eating breakf in silence. A third place is set, but no-one is seated th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara enters and sits down without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said good morning, Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your night? Did you sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudia appears perturbed by Carnegie's subtle probing. Solara flashes him a frosty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did like you asked. Isn't that what you really want to know? Just come out and say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie glares at her sternly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't speak to your father like that. When I ask you a civil question, I expect a civil answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara lowers her head, scorned. Carnegie continues eatin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We didn't talk much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do you think you managed to change his mind about staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He said he had to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie puts down his food, looks angrily at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he did talk? What else did he say? Come on, I want all of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all he said. That he was going to be leaving this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. This is my town, nobody leaves until I say they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances knowingly at Claudia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara, honey, eat something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the food on the plate before her. Then close her eyes and clasps her hands in prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our father, thank you for this meal which you have been so gracious to place before us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudia and Carnegie freeze. Carnegie stares at her, agap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for my mother. Please watch over her and keep her safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for all the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snaps suddenly out of it, looks at her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't respond. Looks embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God didn't put this food on the table. Do you hear me? (BEAT) Who put this food on the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara says nothing, just looks down at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said who put this food on the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SOFTLY) You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who taught you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli taught me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PUZZLED) Who the hell is Eli?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walker. That's his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he taught you how to say those words? How did he know them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had them written down in a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This piques Carnegie's interest greatly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He barks the question at her. Solara is rattled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember! It was an old leather book. It had kind of a... thing on the front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara makes the SIGN OF A CRUCIFIX with her index finger Carnegie's eyes widen; he can barely believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a bible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what it was. A holy bible. Daddy, what's wrong? Did I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie BOLTS SUDDENLY FROM THE TABLE, overturning his c and sending his plate of food crashing to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie races across the landing, toward the ARMED GUARD posted outside Eli's bedroom. The guard steps aside as Carnegie flings the door open and barges inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. No sign of Eli or his gear anywhere. The window is WIDE OPEN, the curtains fluttering gently in the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hands shaking, the engineer disconnects Eli's battery from the generator and places it on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli stands on the other side of the counter with his SHOT TRAINED RIGHT AT THE MAN'S HEAD. He takes the battery fro him and stuffs it into his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie races from the lobby entrance and looks up at th open window to Eli's room. He could have easily jumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge emerges onto the street behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong, boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong? Something wrong? The walker's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be. I had a man outside his room the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumped out the window, you idiot! You didn't think to put a man outside the fucking window? (beat; fuming) Find him. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, he could be anywhere. He... (REALIZATION) A battery. Didn't he say something about a battery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to face the engineer's storefront - just as ELI EMERGES ONTO THE STREET, shotgun still in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYBODY FREEZES. Like a wild west stand-off. Redridge's fingers play over the butt of the pistol on his hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT as time hangs perfectly still for a second... and th ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge draws and FIRES, SHATTERING A PARKING METER just inches from Eli and showering quarters all over the sidew

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli rushes along the sidewalk, RETURNING FIRE. The shot w Redridge in the shoulder. He goes down, wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie dives for cover as FOUR MORE GUNMEN rush from th theater. Carnegie waves frantically in Eli's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spot Eli sprinting away and rush off in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie gets to his feet and storms back inside the thea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara and Claudia watch through the window. Turn suddenl when they hear the door slam open behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie stands in the doorway, glaring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOCAL RESIDENTS scream and rush to and fro in panic as El darts along the boardwalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARNEGIE'S GUNMEN pursue, firing their rifles wildly on t run. The bullets splinter wood, pierce barrels and crates narrowly missing Eli as he dashes, keeping his head down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli aims the shotgun and FIRES without even looking. The HITS A GUNMAN SQUARE IN THE CHEST, dropping him to the di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli hits the deck, diving for cover behind a JUNKPILE as gunfire ricochets all around him. He takes a moment to collect himself, reloads the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three remaining gunmen close in on the junkpile waril

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli signs a cross over himself with the shotgun, looks to sky and offers up a silent prayer. Then emerges from arou the junkpile back into the street. All three gunmen OPEN FIRE, their bullets whipping past on either side of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one swift motion Eli raises the shotgun and FIRES. Thr shots in quick succession. And then there is silence. Smo wisps from the shotgun's sawn-off barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three gunmen LIE DEAD IN THE STREET. One hit square i the chest. The other two each have maybe one half of thei heads remaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli looks around. He's right at the end of the main road, perimeter where the town meets the open desert. He's free

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, A GIRL'S SCREAM. Distant but unmistakable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli whips around. In the upstairs window of the theater, Carnegie shoves Solara roughly against the wall. Barking angrily at her, shaking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli looks at the road. Then up at the theater. Then back the road again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly; to himself) It ain't your concern. Stay on the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he sounds less resolute now than before. Until today was always a simple decision for him to make. But now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He marches back toward the theater, stepping over the fal bodies of the gunmen, re-loading his shotgun as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge finally manages to clamber back up to his feet, wincing as he clutches his painful shoulder wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up just in time to see Eli coming right at him. Without breaking stride, he COLD-COCKS Redridge in the ja with the shotgun, sending him back to the deck, out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli kicks the door wide open, finds Carnegie holding Sola against the wall. She sobs, terrified. Eli levels the sho at Carnegie's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That cannon of yours casts a pretty wide net. I don't reckon you can hit me without hitting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reckon you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holsters the shotgun. Then in the same fluid motion dr a PISTOL from his belt that we never even knew he had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, though? With this I'll shave the hairs clean off your balls at a hundred paces. You believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie releases his grip on Solara, steps away, hands u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you. I have to say I'm surprised to hear that language coming from you, though. I mean, you being a holy man and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Eli glances at Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me all about it. Told me all about the bible, too. (BEAT) Can I see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie takes a small step forward. Suddenly, his whole demeanor changes, and he now looks at Eli imploringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've been searching for a book like that one for years. All I've ever wanted was to bring the word of God to these poor unfortunates here. To shine its light upon them and give them something in this wretched world that they could believe in. Something to live for! It's why I built this town, did you know that? All we've been missing is the word to show us the way. And now, praise the Lord, you've brought it to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie takes a step closer. He appears entirely sincere but then he is very good at doing so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not right to keep that book hidden away, all to yourself. The word is meant to be shared with others. It's meant to be spread! Isn't that what you want? I could help you do that. You and me, we could do it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Eli seems to be considering what he's heard careful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord himself told me that if I carried this book west, one day I would find the place where it was needed. Where it would be safe. Where it belonged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie smiles broadly... and then with a sudden blur of movement Eli PISTOL-WHIPS him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this ain't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Solara and offers her his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli emerges from the theater, leading Solara onto the str RESIDENTS part before them, staring at Eli with astonishm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli passes the statue of Carnegie - and STOPS. Something about that thing is bothering him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shall not make for yourself any graven image...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, drawing his samurai sword and in the same fluid motion SLICING across the base of the statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. And then the STATUE TOPPLES from the neat cut just below the knees, CRASHING DOWN to the ground and SHATTERI The assembled residents GASP at this defiant display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli sheathes his sword and takes Solara by the hand again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE UP over the main street as they both head out of to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town barely visible on the distant horizon behind Eli Solara. Eli walks as he always has, his pace steady and s Still, Solara lags along behind. She's already tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you where I'm going. You're free to go wherever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops in the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... I'm not coming with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're only going to slow me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli doesn't stop walking. Solara is forced to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the hell was all that about back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man was hurting you. I don't like that, so I put a stop to it. Now you're free. He can't hurt you any more. (off her stare) No need to thank me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you? For what? What am I supposed to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want. That's what being free is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever I want. Except go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get where I'm going. I can't be worrying about someone else along the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara is incredibly hurt by this. Blinks back a tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Eli stops and turns back to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dangerous in the outland. I wouldn't want you to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be safe so long as I'm with you. I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli sighs. He's not getting through to her. So now comes harsh truth of it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want this life. I gotta do what I gotta do. Don't have no choice in it. But you do. And I can't let you choose this. You don't want to be like me. You don't want to spend your life alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara steps closer, her eyes pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I came with you, I wouldn't be alone. And neither would you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long BEAT as Eli considers this. For a moment it appear though Solara might have won him over. But then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Look, maybe it's best you just go on back to town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks off, leaving her in the road. She stan there, furious, screaming at his back as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! I'll do just that! I had a life there! A family! I didn't ask you to save me! I didn't ask you for anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't turn or acknowledge her at all. Just keeps wal off into the horizon. Getting smaller all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara stands there in the road, weeping. All alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SOFTLY) Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and walks back in the direction she came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, penned-in area to the rear of the Palladium containing an eclectic bunch of farmyard animals. Goats, sheep, geese, pigs. Mostly mangy, sad-looking specimens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie stands in the yard, tossing handfuls of animal f from a nearby sack onto the ground. He watches with satisfaction as the animals gather at his feet to feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudia emerges from the theater with an ice-pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie applies it to his jaw, red and swollen from Eli' pistol-whip. Redridge appears nearby, his arm in a sling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed four of my men and walked out of town without a scratch. They shot off a hundred rounds at him and he didn't get hit once. I never even heard of anything like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie doesn't appear to be listening. He is lost in a world of his own as he tends to the farm animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I always thought of myself as a shepherd. Bringing together the wayward and the lost. Tending to my flock. But all the things I want to do, I can't do them on my own. The one thing I've needed is the one thing that's always been missing. Then one day it walks right into town - so close I can almost touch it - and then walks right on out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie finally looks up from his animals, at Redridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to put a crew together and go out after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going to work for you. I think he's made that plain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in him any more. I only want the book he's carrying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm gonna risk my ass hunting down this maniac in the outland, I need to know it's gonna be worth it. I need to know what's so special about this goddamn book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT as Carnegie considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea. You're too young, you don't remember the world before. But I do. I remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to his animals, summoning up old memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a kid my parents used to read that book every goddamn day. My mother, she'd read it along with this smooth-talking preacher on the TV screen. They used to be able to beam these guys right into your house, into every house in the world, through the air. Like magic. (BEAT) She worked two jobs and she sent every spare penny she had to that fucking guy on the TV. My old man, he'd read that book, then he'd get liquored up and kick my ass, tell me all about the power and the glory and how I was going to burn forever in hell for the sins I was born with. He made sure he beat it into me good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps out of his reverie and looks at Redridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see? It's not just any book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARNEGIE (cont'd) It has the power to motivate people. It can give them hope, it can terrify them. It can shape them. Control them. (BEAT) Do you remember how I built this town? It wasn't done with force, and it wasn't done just with water. It was done with the power of words. I created this place out of nothing, because people believed in a promise that I sold to them. Those guys on the TV, they were richer than you could ever dream, and it was all built the same way. With words. With promises. And with that book. (BEAT) That book is a weapon. Aimed right at the hearts and minds of the weak and the desperate. Just imagine what I could do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss... we're running out of water and the people are running out of patience. You're trying to tell me that a book is going to keep them in line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it'll do much more than that. The water in this town may run dry, but faith - that springs eternal! And that faith will help turn this town into a city. And this city into a nation. It will help me build a new world. In my image. People will come from far and wide to hear what's inside of it. They'll follow me anywhere just to get a taste of it. And they'll do whatever I tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As usual, Carnegie's slick rhetoric has worked - Redridge totally bought into it. Claudia, however, looks appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if this book don't work? What if it don't say what you want it to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it'll say what I want, I can promise you that. Because I'm going to rewrite it. I'll keep the parts that work for me and make the rest whatever I need it to be. (BEAT) A new bible, for a new world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out and takes Claudia by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, darling? A whole new world, to do with as we will. Won't that be grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles halfheartedly, but it's clear she is mortified

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie turns back to Redridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find that book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has half a day on us already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So use the motor pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ain't much gas in reserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever there is, use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge nods and goes to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Solara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. In all this excitement about the book, she had been completely forgotten about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still out there. With him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Right. Of course. Bring her back, too, if you can. But-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The book. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge turns and leaves. Claudia scowls at Carnegie, bu doesn't even notice, just goes back to feeding his animal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara wanders the road. She's tired. The sun beats down mercilessly. Nothing but desolation and wasteland all aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes to a FORK IN THE ROAD. Stops at the junction, unsure. Was this here before? She doesn't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no signs. Both paths look the same. Which one i which? She turns and looks back, looks around. She's lost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She alternates her finger between the two paths. Eeny-mee miney-moe. Picks a path and follows it, headed down the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli walks on. Slow and steady. His gaze, as ever, fixed firmly on the horizon. Takes a swig from his canteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he STOPS and stands stock still in the center o the road. Impossible to know what he's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara comes upon an abandoned CHEVRON STATION. She doesn remember passing this. Looks back up and down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a RUSTED CAR parked at one of the pumps. Like eve other car we've seen, stripped of its tires and engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks around to the driver's side. A PETRIFIED FEMALE BODY lies on the ground, half-in, half-out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara claps her hand to her mouth and recoils, horrified

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dead woman's hand is a dusty bottle of MINERAL WAT Solara hesitates. Not wanting to get closer. But so thirs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She braces herself, grimacing, and tries to take the bott but the dead woman's hand is closed tight around it. She pulls harder and wrenches it free. In the process she fal on her butt and flips the corpse over onto its back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the other woman's arm, she has a SKELETAL BABY cradled her bosom. It seems to be staring right at Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara SCREAMS and frantically shuffles backward away fro it. Gets to her feet and runs across the forecourt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops by the station shop and rests against the wall, hyperventilating, heart pounding. Trying to get it togeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She inspects the water in the bottle. It looks clean. Unscrews the cap with shaking hands and takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SPITS IT BACK OUT, coughing. It's rank. Undrinkable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara enters. Gloomy inside. Comprehensively looted. Emp shelves coated in thick sheets of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves further in, searching for something, anything. the place has been gutted. There's nothing. She checks th wall of dead refrigerators. Shattered glass, all empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's never known desolation and emptiness like this. It' beginning to scare her. She wheels around in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant, calling from outside. Solara hears it and freeze

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Can anyone help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs out across the forecourt, onto the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEMALE FIGURE is hunched by the side of the road about fifty yards up ahead. Hard to see what she's doing from h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Is anybody there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara starts walking toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman has her back to Solara. She's on her knees, muttering to herself. Gathering objects up from the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Solara moves closer, we see that the woman is struggli with an UPTURNED SHOPPING CART. Stuck in a roadside ditch its contents spilled out next to a few BRACKEN BUSHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see her face now. It's the SAME YOUNG WOMAN from befor The same shopping cart. The same trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks around, sees Solara standing nearby. She' shocked to see that it's a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes, I'm fine. Thank you. You go along, I'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you need some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really! I'm fine. Really... I need a man to help. Not you. You just keep along. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman seems anxious to get rid of her. Tries to indic the threat silently with her eyes, but Solara doesn't get

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just take a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into the ditch and starts to haul the cart out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, it's fine! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too   late. THREE ROAD BRIGANDS POUNCE FROM THE BUSHES. E bit   as brutish and horrifying as the group that Eli kil the   road in our opening. They grab Solara and drag her the   road into the desert, screaming and kicking all the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go! She ain't got nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRIGAND LEADER looks Solara up and down lustfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't too sure about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara is reviled by the man. He's filthy, his stench overpowering. One eye missing, just a dark, empty socket. licks his lips, revealing a mouth almost devoid of teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't the deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brigand leader lashes out and grabs her by the throat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth, bitch. You oughta be grateful you're getting a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He releases her. She slumps to the dirt, whimpering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never did care much for that dried- up old snatch anyhow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back to the struggling Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one, though... this one looks fresh. You a virgin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says nothing, just sobs helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unbuckles his pants, lets them drop to his ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a sound. It's hard to place. Something like a THH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brigand leader is frozen in shock. His face goes pale the blood draining from it. The two bandits holding Solar look at their leader in dismay. Staring down at his crotc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet whimper escapes from his lips as he looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an ARROW IMBEDDED IN HIS CROTCH. What was once d there is now just a bloody mess of mangled meat. More blo streams down his thighs. A real horror show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He staggers backward, shrieking. Hands shaking. Staring d at the awful wound from which the long arrow shaft extend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two other brigands release Solara and whip around, scanning the horizon. They see nothing. One of them has a RIFLE. He unslings it and aims it frantically around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they both see it. Coming right at them. The most terrifying thing either has ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, WALKING TOWARD THEM FROM THE ROAD, OUT OF THE SUN. H
dialogues.text: silhouette distorted in the rippling heat. An avenging an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls another arrow and draws it back as the rifle ban trains his weapon on him, finger tightening on the trigge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli SHOOTS. The arrow sails through the air and RIGHT INT THE RIFLE BARREL. The feathers at the end of the shaft plugging the muzzle tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rifle bandit pulls the trigger. The gun EXPLODES, BLOWING HANDS CLEAN OFF. He falls to the ground, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli only had two arrows. He shoulders the bow and draws h sword. All the remaining brigand has is a small knife. Th two now square off at arm's length. A hopeless mismatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. The knife brigand hesitates, trembling. And then RU ELI WITH THE KNIFE. Eli deftly sidesteps, flourishes the sword. So quick it almost seems like he didn't move at al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knife bandit staggers forward a couple more steps. Hi hand goes limp and drops the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then his HEAD FALLS BACKWARD like a Pez dispenser. Al completely decapitated, but not quite. Blood fountains fr the neck stump as his body falls to the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli moves to the other two bandits who lay horribly wound on the ground, but still breathing. He stands over their fallen bodies. They stare back up at him, helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crouches down between them in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I offer you both one final chance in this life to seek forgiveness for your sins so that your souls may find salvation. Will you say with me the act of contrition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brigand leader defiantly spits blood at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli sighs. Stands and looks down on him without pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some might think it'd be most fitting to leave you here like this. Let you die slow in the sun. But I know better. I know where you're going. And the sooner you get there, the sooner you'll get what's coming to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plunges his sword into the bandit leader, finishing hi off. Pulls the arrow from his crotch and wipes it clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the other man, raising his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli pauses, sword hovering over him, poised to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to say it. I want to be forgiven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli crouches once more by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat after me. Oh God, I am heartily sorry for having offended thee, and I detest all my sins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bandit follows along with Eli, mouthing the words quietly. The life ebbing from him with each moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I firmly resolve, with the help of thy grace, to confess my sins, and do penance, and to amend my life. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes roll back as his final breath leaves him. Dead. signs a cross over his body, then stands and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara sits on the ground nearby, a wreck. Eli approaches gathers her up in his arms. She clings on to him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are friends for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs, a tear rolling down her cheek. Grips him tigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps her up and escorts her back to the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the deal. You keep up. You pull your weight. You fall behind, I can't help you. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at the young woman still slumped in the di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing can be done for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk on down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METAL GARAGE DOORS roll back to reveal darkness within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF HEADLIGHTS fires up. Full beam right at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VEHICLE roars out of the darkness onto the street. Heav modified with plate armor and turret-mounted weapons. But original form still recognizable underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a HONDA ODYSSEY minivan. Once the #1 choice of socce moms, transformed now into an armored personnel carrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another minivan roars from the garage behind it. A DODGE GRAND CARAVAN, similarly customized and armed to the teet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE MORE CARS follow. As eclectic an assortment as you could imagine. A MINI COOPER. FORD EXPLORER. A PRIUS. Eac adorned with plate armor and weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lead Minivan is REDRIDGE, heavily armed. He nods t the DRIVER, who guns the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fleet of armored vehicles moves out, kicking up a gre funnel of dust in their wake as they roar out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late afternoon. The sun hangs low on the horizon. We're f from the road. Nothing but scrub brush and a few PRAIRIE BURROWS dotted around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PRAIRIE DOG pops its head up, scans the horizon. Sniffi the air, whiskers twitching... and is SKEWERED BY AN ARRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty yards away, one of the pieces of scrub brush appea to COME ALIVE. And then we realize it is Eli's GHILLIE SU camouflaging both he and Solara beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli casts off the camouflage net and walks toward the dea prairie dog. Solara just stands there, appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed it! That cute little thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli picks up the dead animal by the scruff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good eating, is what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks out the bloody arrow. Solara looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she turns back, Eli is standing right there, holding dead animal in front of her face. She YELPS in surprise a staggers backward, falling on her butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're going to be on the road, you can't be picky about what you eat. You eat what's there to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not eating that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SHRUGS) More for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara sit in the mouth of a desert cave, around flickering campfire. The prairie dog roasts on a spit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli digs his knife into the carcass, the blade comes out clean. It's done. He clasps his hands together and gazes penitently at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, we thank you for your generosity in providing us with this meal. Bless this food to our use and us to thy service, and keep us ever mindful of the needs of others. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli carves off a piece of meat. Juicy and succulent. He b into it, teasing Solara by making a show of how good it tastes. He feeds a piece to the rat perched on his should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara tries to appear uninterested, but she's starved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that taste like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes another bite, thinks on this as he chews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tastes like chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to fight the temptation to try it... but she ca She reaches out and tears off a piece. Sniffs at it, take small bite... then quickly wolfs down the rest. Eli smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she eats, she gestures toward Eli's Saint Christopher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli reaches up and touches his hand to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Saint Christopher medal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Saint Christopher? Is he a character from your book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christopher was a man who lived a long time ago. He wanted to be a good man, he wanted to help people. So he would stand by a river that had no bridge and carry people across. He was a big strong man and there was no one he couldn't carry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara listens, rapt. Eli is a good storyteller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then one day a young child came to the river and asked to be carried across. Christopher tried to carry him but he was too heavy. He was just a small boy but he was heavier than any man he had ever carried. The boy explained that he was the son of God, and that he was so heavy because he bore all the sins of the world. After that, Christopher was able to carry him across and when they got to the other side the boy baptized him in the river. And that's how he became a saint. Later on, he was known as the patron saint of travelers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is a saint, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's someone who spent their life doing good things for others. Enough that God himself took a special interest in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara looks at Eli tenderly, with admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli looks away, down at the ground. He appears sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not like me. Saints ain't killers. And I done too much of that. Spilled too much blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. No words, just the flickering firelight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you read me some more from the book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. You should get some sleep. Maybe tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire down to its last embers. Eli sleeps next to his pack, half-hidden in the looming shadows of the cave. His and goggles hung up for the night on the hilt of his swor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara sleeps nearby... then opens her eyes. Not asleep a all. She looks over at Eli - his face hidden in shadow an impossible to tell if he's asleep or awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Quietly, she moves forward, kneeling by his side. She opens his coat and checks the pockets. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes deeper, peeling back the layers of clothing, stealthily frisking him. She finds something on his lapel hidden under several layers, that causes her to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a RECTANGULAR PLASTIC BADGE. The red, white and blue colors faded and worn. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at it for a moment, not knowing what to make o it. Then moves on, continuing to pat him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever she's looking for is not here. She turns her attention to the backpack. Slowly, carefully, opens it up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. THE BIBLE, wrapped carefully in its neat lit package of cloth and twine. She reaches in for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, ELI'S HAND SHOOTS OUT AND GRABS HER BY THE WRIS She cries out, startled. Eli sits up, his face just a dar shape in the shadows. For the first time he appears a lit scary to Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared me! I thought you were asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the road you sleep with one eye open. I asked you what you were doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to see the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see the book, you ask me. Nobody touches it but me. Ever. Until it gets where it's going. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very forceful. She nods, a little afraid of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grips her wrist tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! I understand! Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli releases her wrist. Takes the pack from her and close up. Pulls it closer to him and lies back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use to you anyway. You don't know how to read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... now we have the time, maybe you can teach me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies back down beside him, but doesn't close her eyes She just lies there, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises out of the east. And out of the sun comes t FLEET OF ARMORED VEHICLES. Racing side-by-side down the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead vehicle comes to a halt. A door opens and Redrid gets out. MORE ARMED MEN emerge from the other vehicles a follow him as he marches into the wasteland by the roadsi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DEAD BRIGANDS are splayed out in the dirt where Eli s them. A FLOCK OF BUZZARDS is picking their bones clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge looks at the footprints in the dirt headed from bodies and back onto the road. Two sets of tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl's with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves back to the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other men hold for a moment, still looking at the hal eaten bodies in the dirt. Redridge turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said move out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard this guy's protected somehow, some... power from up above. That there ain't nothing on this earth can touch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just a man. You put a bullet in him, he'll go down like any other. I don't want to hear no more of this superstitious horseshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesitantly, they make their way back to the vehicles. The cars gun their engines and move on down the road, past th abandoned Chevron station. Dust pluming in their wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara walk together, passing by a few burned-out buildings. It appears we might be headed toward a town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara looks up at the sweltering sun. Then around at her surroundings. Nothing but devastation and decay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say you've been walking for twenty-five years. Have you ever considered that you might be lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how can you know? How can you know this is the right way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. My path has been laid out before me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but laid out by who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Almighty God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if this God guy's so mighty, how come it's taking you so long to get where you're going? Doesn't he know the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli wheels around and jabs a scolding finger at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to stay on this road with me, don't ever let me hear you take his name in vain like that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara is surprised by the severity of his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli resumes walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God has a reason for everything being the way it is. It's not always apparent to us. But it is his plan nonetheless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, is he talking to you right now? Telling you where to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like that. It's kinda hard to explain. I'm guided by faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what that word means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT as Eli thinks on how to explain it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you know something even though you don't know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara thinks about this, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't make any sense at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the outskirts of a small town that lies in ruins. Almo every building burned or reduced to rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for one SMALL HOUSE. The building is damaged and w but in mostly decent condition. It stands out among its surroundings for being the only structure still intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows are BARRED. The outer structure fortified wit SHEET METAL and other custom patch-ups. The whole plot surrounded by a CHAIN-LINK FENCE TOPPED WITH RAZOR WIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara crouch behind a pile of rubble nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. It looks almost... normal. Like nothing ever happened. How can it still be out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should look inside. There might be food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT as Eli considers. Then stands and unhooks his shotgu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay behind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the house cautiously. Arrive at the perimet fence. There's a gate held in place by a PADLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli pulls a pair of BOLT-CUTTERS from his belt and snips padlock free. Swings open the gate with a metallic SQUEAK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move inside, up the garden path. Though the soil in yard is dead, it's been carefully raked and tended. WEEDS arranged in thoughtful patterns, like real flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli steps forward, his foot planting on a CRACKED PAVING STONE that shifts almost imperceptibly under his feet. Accompanied by a barely audible SOUND. He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROPE NOOSE suddenly whips around their feet, tightening their ankles and YANKING THEM UPSIDE-DOWN INTO THE AIR. E drops his shotgun to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hang there for a moment, twisting in the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door to the house SWINGS OPEN to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
