dialogues.text: AN ELDERLY COUPLE. The woman's gray hair tied into a neat bun. The man bald, squinting through wire-frame glasses. look like the couple from Grant Wood's "American Gothic."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of a pitchfork the man holds a 12-GAUGE RIOT SHOT which he keeps trained from the hip on Eli and Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step outside, regarding their new visitors carefully The man seems more suspicious than his wife. He drags Eli shotgun toward him with his foot, hands it to his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Eli. This is Solara. We're travelers, that's all. We don't mean you any harm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut my padlock. I saw you. Trying to break into our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. We didn't think anybody lived here. We thought it was abandoned, like all the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This seems to annoy the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look around you. Look at this yard. Does it look abandoned to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly he's proud of the work he's done with the pitiful means at his disposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. I... like what you've done with the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your business here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No business. We're sorry to have troubled you. If you'll let us down we'll happily be on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wife steps forward, she's much warmer, less guarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, look at them! They're not robbers or road agents! One of them's just a girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen that before. Oldest trick in the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop! It's no trick. Let them down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman glares at him. The husband reluctantly accedes moves to the concealed trap apparatus. Releases the rope, dropping Eli and Solara to the ground in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman helps them to their feet. They shake off th noose from their ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry about my husband. We so rarely get visitors these days, he's suspicious of everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Martha and this is my husband George. Would you care for some tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara exchange a look. What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like something out of the world before. The interior almost perfectly preserved. Chintzy couches. A mahogany table. A TV set in the corner. Lace curtains. Unreal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara sit on the couch, feeling self-conscious a looking entirely out of place in this cozy environment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sits across from them on the couch, scowling at th inhospitably. The shotgun resting across his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha emerges from the kitchen, carrying a tray laden wi tea pot and old china cups. Cracked and faded, but intact She places the tray on the coffee table and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we don't have any cake or biscuits for the tea. They ran out some time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts the tea port and pours into the cups. But it's tea, only water. Somewhat murky water. Eli and Solara sta at the cups, unsure. Martha gestures toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They raise their cups and take a sip. Martha watches eage It's clearly a thrill for her to be doing something as civilized and elegant as serving "tea" to guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's.. uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha smiles, delighted. She lifts her own cup to her li HER HANDS TREMBLE, the cup rattling against the saucer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you always lived here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For almost forty years now. This home is our pride and joy, isn't it, George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George just grunts. Not interested in conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We refused to leave, even during the troubles. We said, didn't we George, we said if we're going to die anywhere, we're going to die right here, in our own home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand how you've survived out here this long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, George is something of a handyman, aren't you, dear? He did a lot of work on the place, making it safe. We may be old, but we're resilient. We've had more than a few who've tried to take this place from us. Haven't we, George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes we have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands and moves toward the back door. Opens it up and beckons Eli and Solara to come look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara stand in the doorway, looking out on the y Solara is horrified by what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire back yard is a GRAVEYARD. Maybe twenty human graves dug shallow into the earth. Some were dug long ago others look like they're very recent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these... graves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. It would be uncivilized not to bury them. We're not barbarians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, it's good for the soil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on back inside. I think I might be able to rustle up some sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Martha go back inside, leaving Eli and Solara gazing at the little graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look so sweet... I would never have believed they were killers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're worse than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't just kill these people. (BEAT) They ate them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a disease in the outland. Spread by eating human meat. It affects the brain. Dementia, loss of motor function. Did you notice the old woman's hands shaking? She's got it. They've both got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara re-enter. Solara looks at George nervously He's still carrying that shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha's voice drifts in from the nearby KITCHEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found some meat for those sandwiches! Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really must be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unnerving glint in his eye. Eli moves toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm afraid so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he gets to the door, George moves to intercept. Hard t tell if he's blocking his path or moving to open the door him. A tense BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha emerges from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you won't stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you again for the tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli stares George down. Reluctantly, George steps aside. opens the door and escorts Solara outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara emerge into the sunlight. Walk down the ga path. And FREEZE IN THEIR TRACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ARMED VEHICLES ARE COMING. Driving toward them out of horizon in a hazy cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... it's my dad. It's his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recognize the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli bundles Solara back into the house. George stands in doorway, squinting at the approaching convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George follows them back in, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you bring upon us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whole convoy of armed degenerates, that's what's wrong! Coming here for them! And they led them right to us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha rushes to the window, pulls aside the lace curtain Outside she sees the armored vehicles SCREECHING TO A HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men spill out from the vehicles and take cover behind them, locking and loading weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no they don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes across the room, teeth gritted with determinat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally got this house just the way I want it. I'm not going to let anybody tear it apart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the couch and yanks off the seat cushions. Underneath is a WOODEN LID which she throws open to revea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE CACHE OF WEAPONS. Automatic rifles. Shotguns. Pist Grenades. And enough ammunition for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out an M-60 MACHINE-GUN, slings the strap over shoulder and locks in a CHAIN OF BULLETS. She looks like post-apocalyptic Martha Stewart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George pulls out an AK-47, slots in a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took `em off them who came looking to take the place from us. Built up quite the stash over the years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers a .44 MAGNUM to Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to fire a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy showed me once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like riding a bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never rode a bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sighs, turns instead to Eli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you, you know how to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli is already reloading his shotgun, checking the barrel Readying the weapon in the practiced manner of an expert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge steps forward, raises a BULLHORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know you're in there! Come on out with your hands up and your weapons on the deck and nobody needs to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. No sign of activity inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge turns back to his men. Their hands trembling. Th didn't sign up for this, and they're not ready for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge turns back to the house. Into the bullhorn:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, look. I'm gonna make it easy on y'all. Bring out the girl with the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli is crouched beneath the window. George and Martha hav taken up positions at other windows, peering out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all we want. The girl and the book. The rest of you's can go your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT as Eli thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand me my pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge waits. Still no sign of a response. His nervous gunmen exchange worried looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ain't comin' out. They-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge raises his hand to silence him. Looks up as an UPSTAIRS WINDOW slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLOTH PACKAGE is tossed from the window. It lands in th dirt outside the perimeter fence a few yards from Redridg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously, he approaches. The package is wrapped in clot and tied up with twine. It looks like Eli's bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks it up and tugs at the twine, untying it. Folds a the cloth wrapping. Looks for a moment in puzzlement at t object, at the words written on the front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a MINIATURE CLAYMORE MINE. The small red light on to the unit ILLUMINATES WITH A BEEP. Armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the package in the dirt and races for his life b toward the vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down! Everybody get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dives across the trunk of the Explorer into cover as T MINE EXPLODES, SHATTERING EVERY WINDOW OF EVERY VEHICLE. lightweight Mini Cooper takes the main brunt and EXPLODES cartwheeling through the air, a burning wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge looks around. Three men lie dead already. Flamin wreckage all around him. Suddenly, it's a war zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACHINE-GUN FIRE ERUPTS FROM THE HOUSE, peppering the vehicles' armor. The gunmen cower behind cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, return fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge aims at the house and OPENS FIRE. Inspired by hi example, the others follow. A HAIL OF BULLETS CRISS-CROSS BACK AND FORTH. The house's faded paint facade is shredde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha continues firing wildly with the M-60. Screaming a the top of her lungs, loving every minute of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get it, you god-damn sons of mother-fucking bitches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Eli also open fire from their windows, periodically ducking to take cover from incoming fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara sits across the room, in the corner, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. We're going to be all right. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE GUNFIRE splinters the window frame above his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember what I told you about faith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli peeks out and FIRES OUT THE WINDOW, dropping one of t enemy gunmen with a crack shot. Ducks back down as the re fire impacts around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get out of this alive. Both of us. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because God told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because God told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst all the chaos and gunfire, George has been listeni to this exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't mention you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. George chambers a round and RESUMES FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge's men continue the hail of gunfire. Six of them now, six more still standing. No lessening of fire from inside the house. They're losing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge races between the vehicles, ducking from gunfire until he makes it to the back of the Dodge Caravan. Pops trunk and pulls out a ROCKET-PROPELLED GRENADE LAUNCHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets it on his shoulder, rests on the trunk to steady aim. And FIRES. The rocket screams toward its target, tea through the chain fence and TEARING AN ENTIRE CORNER FROM HOUSE in a fiery explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with smoke. The sounds of COUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, George pushes his way through the smoke, waving hi arms to clear it. A BLOODY GASH on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha? Martha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds her lying on the tile floor in what remains of t kitchen. Or at least her top half. The rest of her is gon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George slumps to his knees with tear-filled eyes. Takes h wife tenderly by the hand for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the anger returns. He gets up and turns, consumed no a wild fury. Firing with rage over the torn brick wall. H CLIPS ANOTHER GUNMAN IN THE HEAD, killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George moves back toward the LIVING ROOM, firing as he go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge moves between the cars again, staying behind cov George's hail of gunfire has them pinned down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got any more of those RPGs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge jumps into the driver's seat of the minivan, tur the key in the ignition. Jams the accelerator down with t butt of his rifle, then shifts the transmission into DRIV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen leap clear as the minivan HURTLES TOWARD THE HOUSE, engine roaring. CRASHES THROUGH THE CHAIN FENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli looks up from cover and see the van coming RIGHT AT H He dives clear as the van CRASHES THROUGH THE WALL INTO T LIVING ROOM. It SMASHES INTO THE FAR WALL, finally coming a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More dust and debris, more coughing. Eli tries to get up, winces in pain. Puts his hand to his side, it comes back WITH BLOOD. A bad wound. He covers it with his coat, stan and moves through the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds her in the smoke. She embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the smoke clears, Solara sees George PINNED AGAINST TH WALL BY THE MINIVAN. His body crushed. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. We're going out the back. We're running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he helps her to her feet, we hear the sound of MOVEMEN THROUGH THE RUBBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn around. The gunmen are ENTERING THE HOUSE, pass through the smoking hole left by the minivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli reaches for his sword. Met by the sound of MULTIPLE G COCKING. Redridge steps out from among the gunmen. Smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and try it, holy man. You ain't that fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara are shoved out of the house at gunpoint an marched past the torn perimeter fence to the vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli has been stripped of his weapons and backpack. Redrid faces him and points a pistol at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Eli doesn't answer. Redridge cocks the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge stares him down. Eli just stares right back. Tot unflappable. Redridge motions to his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunman carrying Eli's pack opens it up and tips its contents out onto the ground. The ghillie suit, battery, old canned goods, other odds and ends. No sign of the boo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gotta be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge holsters his gun and frisks Eli, going through h pockets. Finds nothing. He opens Eli's coat and checks th inside pockets. Digs around deep inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, what have we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then suddenly he SHRIEKS IN PAIN. Yanks his hand out reveal ELI'S RAT, TEETH SUNK DEEP INTO HIS FLESH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge flails around violently, trying to get the rat o him, but it won't let go. His hand is bleeding badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Get it off! Get it off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally manages to shake it free. It hits the floor da Redridge STOMPS ON IT with his boot, reducing it to a blo smear in the dirt. Eli lowers his head in sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge clutches his bloody hand, glares at Eli furiousl Pulls his gun again and marches right up to him, pressing muzzle tight against his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't got the book, what fucking use are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His finger tightens on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks from the gunmen holding her and rushes toward Redridge. Reaches inside her dress and PRODUCES THE BIBLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here! I've got it! Please don't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a book, Eli. No book is worth giving up your life for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied, Redridge takes the book. Runs his hand over th leather cover, gazes admiringly at the gold-embossed cros

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good, sweetheart. Your daddy would be proud. He knew you'd come through for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara looks at Eli guiltily. She feels terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he would hurt my mom. If I didn't help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SMILING) Daddy's little girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara stands between him and Eli. Deadly serious now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got what you came for. You don't need him. Let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's killed a dozen of my men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hurt him, I'm not coming back with you. You'll have to drag me kicking and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara glares at Redridge. He sighs. He can tell she mean it. It's not worth the aggravation. He turns back to Eli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your shit and get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli gathers up his stuff into his pack. Shoulders it and to pick up his sword, but Redridge puts his boot on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli still has a half-dozen guns trained on him. He turns walks away, toward the road. As he passes Solara:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you we'd both live. Now do you have faith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear runs down Solara's cheek as she watches him walk a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge grabs her by the arm and pulls her toward the vehicles as his men load up and prepare to move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara sits in the back seat, staring out the rear window it drives down the road at the tail end of the convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches as Eli moves away down the road, getting smal and smaller until he is just a speck on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bursts into floods of uncontrollable tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara in the back seat, calmer now. The tears dried on h cheeks. She sits staring blankly at the DRIVER in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then she LUNGES VIOLENTLY FORWARD. Clawing and biting the driver, who struggles to fight her off. His hands com off the wheel and the car FISHTAILS WILDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER sees something odd in the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge turns to see the car behind VEERING ERRATICALLY SLAMMING ON THE BRAKES, stopping in the middle of the roa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car screeches to a halt. Redridge watches through the rear window as the driver's side door opens and the drive KICKED OUT ONTO THE ASPHALT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes again, the engine revs and the car TURNS AROUND, racing back down the road in the direction it cam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Turn around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't got the gas for it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's getting away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the book! And we got barely enough gas to make it back as it is! We can't go chasin' her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Redridge knows he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid little bitch... (BEAT) Drive on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car moves on, following the rest of the convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara screeches the car to a halt outside the smoking wreckage of the besieged house. She runs from the vehicle where ELI'S SWORD lies in the dirt and grabs it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara races down the road in the car, pedal to the metal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually, she sees him. At first just a dot on the hori But unmistakably Eli. By now, she'd know him anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the engine SPLUTTERS. She checks the fuel gauge; needle deep in the red. She pounds the wheel in frustrati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car grinds to a halt, dead. She flings open the door leaps out of the vehicle, rushing after Eli on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ELI. As always, his pace steady and slow. The sun dire ahead of him as it sets on the horizon. Headed always wes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara is running up behind him, a hundred yards back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli! Eli!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't stop or look back. Just keeps on walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally catches up with him, breathing hard, exhauste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you'd gone back to town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back there. Eli, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? I betrayed you! I gave them the book!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did what you believed you had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues walking alongside him. Trying to process th This kind of compassion is totally foreign to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out the sword, offering it to Eli by way of atonement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. I thought you might still need this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli seems appreciative that she would think to return it him. He takes it and slings it over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same as always. Keep heading west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? I mean, you don't have the book any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I still have my faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk on together, into the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara follow the road through burned-out towns a retail neighborhoods. Gutted and dead, like every place e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But something is different here. Things are greener. Tuft grass here and there. They attract Solara's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli reaches down and runs his hand through the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's grass. It used to grow all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come it's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Less poison in the air this near to the ocean, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep walking. Eli groans, clutches his side. Does hi best to hide his pain from Solara. She notices anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just a cramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk on through the night. Eli stops and sniffs the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you smell that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smell what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt in the air. We're close to the ocean. We're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep on along the road. A shallow uphill incline. Th follow it uphill, finally reaching its crest, where they and take in the view before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PACIFIC OCEAN. Straddled by the GOLDEN GATE BRIDGE - once-great structure has partially collapsed from decades neglect and disrepair. The span sags and hangs low over t ocean, the asphalt cracked and ruptured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the bay, SAN FRANCISCO - or the litt that remains of it. The city has been almost TOTALLY DESTROYED - entire areas reduced to rubble, the few build still standing looking on the verge of collapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara looks at it all in horrified awe. Eli, unperturbed keeps on moving, still clutching his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara make their way south across the bridge, si stepping the fractures in the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli leads Solara through the rubble of what used to be Sa Francisco. It's like walking through the wreckage of 9/11 Ground Zero, but a hundred times the scale. Horrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass by the wreckage of a HOTEL, nothing but the lob still standing. A HILTON sign protruding from the rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli uses his sheathed sword as a walking stick, poking ar ahead of him for loose rubble underfoot. He steps careful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your footing. Step where I step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More buildings are still standing here, but they're nothi more than great dead monoliths. Solara looks up at the blasted skyscrapers - she's never seen anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buildings loom over her like giant tombstones. It sca her - like walking through the graveyard of a dead world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This... this is the world before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's left of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep walking, passing the TOPPLED TRANSAMERICA PYRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once a bustling oceanside tourist spot, now a ghost town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara walk along the litter-strewn street, passi the old RIPLEY'S BELIEVE-IT-OR-NOT and WAX MUSEUMS. The celebrity mannequins are still in fair condition, but slu at their feet are CHARRED HUMAN SKELETONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli is struggling now. He looks pale from the blood loss. breathing labored. Solara takes him by the arm to help hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dead, ruined place, like everywhere else. We hear the s of SEAGULLS nearby - the only sign of life at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara walk along the pier, until they reach its The original end has long since collapsed into the sea, b RICKETY HAND-MADE ROPE BRIDGE has been affixed to the pie sheared-off edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara stand at the pier's end, looking out to se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see it. Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal now that the rope-bridge leads out across the bay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking much the same as it always has, old and dilapidat The coastal fog shrouding it gives it an ethereal look. I feels almost like a mythic place - the "promised land" El has sought for so many years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tattered STARS AND STRIPES still flutters in the breeze atop the prison lighthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara make their way carefully across the bridge feels highly unstable and sags low over the bay, the wate below close enough to lap around their ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara arrive at the prison gates. Securely locke As they inspect it for a possible way to enter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who goes there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up. A GUARD in paramilitary fatigues is station in one of the perimeter towers. Training a rifle on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identify yourselves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the opposite tower ANOTHER GUARD has his rifle trained them too. Eli looks up, raises his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Elijah Stone. I have a message for your boss. I need you to tell him that I have a King James Bible in my possession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remain where you are! Do not attempt to move or you will be fired upon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping the gun trained on them, the tower guard uses his free hand to talk into a WALKIE-TALKIE RADIO. We don't he the conversation. All Eli and Solara can do is wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard puts away his radio and shouts back down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be prepared to surrender any weapons at the gate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. And then the massive front gates SLOWLY OPEN ON MECHANICAL RUNNERS with the low groan of rusted iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara look at each other, then step gingerly ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as they step inside they are SURROUNDED BY DOZENS HEAVILY-ARMED SOLDIERS. Not U.S. military, more like a se official militia. But every bit as deadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Solara raise their hands. A pair of SOLDIERS take Eli's pack and sword, pat them both down for other weapon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers before them part - to reveal a THIN, BALDING wearing spectacles. He wears Kevlar body armor over his t jacket and tie. Professorial, academic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches, shakes Eli's hand vigorously - very excite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, both of you. I'm Professor Lombardi. I'm the curator here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah Stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara. What a delightful name. Is that by any chance Shakespearean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, I think it's Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Eli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true what they tell me? You have a King James Version?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been carrying it with me for twenty- five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara looks at Eli, puzzled. Lombardi finds it hard to contain his excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness. I can't tell you how exciting this is. Well, come, come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOMBARDI (cont'd) I'll give you the nickel tour and then we can all sit down and take a look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads them across the courtyard into the prison buildi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge's remaining vehicles drive back into town and co to a halt outside the theater. Redridge emerges from his carrying the bible. Walks up to the Palladium and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was once a cell block is now an IMMENSE LIBRARY. Sta floor to ceiling with books. Lombardi shows Eli and Solar around. Behind them, a pair of ARMED GUARDS follow closel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we've been doing this for some time now. Collected over thirty thousand volumes from generous donors all across the nation. We even have a printing press that we hope to have operational soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara is stunned as she surveys the endless stacks of bo She's never seen anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turned the whole prison into a library?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not exactly. We're more like a storage facility. We're holding these books here in trust, if you like. When society gets back on its feet and no longer needs us to preserve these volumes, they'll be here waiting. (BEAT) I must ask you, how did you hear about us? We've been doing everything we can to get the word out, but we always like to know where our benefactors come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sent here by God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lombardi raises a quizzical eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right? Well, it's good to know we're getting such high- profile referrals these days. (BEAT) I must say, I am so excited that we finally have a King James. You know, we have a Talmud here, we have two Korans, we even have that Scientology book. But never a Christian bible, until now. I honestly believed it was the one book I'd never see again, after what happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Lombardi appears sad for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask what condition it's in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little beat-up. But it'll do the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then. What say we take a look at it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lombardi looks at Eli with anticipation. So does Solara, interested to know where this is going to go next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli winces in pain, puts his hand to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there someplace we could sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Right this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge appears. Carnegie looks at him eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge holds the bible up proudly. Carnegie beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redridge hands it over. Carnegie sits back in his chair, running his hand lovingly over the battered leather cover

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new world begins here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the book and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. And then he looks up at Redridge, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli, Solara and Lombardi sit at one of the long lunch-roo tables. The two armed guards keep watch nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have something you can write with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm? Oh, yes of course!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a pen from his pocket, motions to one of the gua

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you please bring us some writing paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard nods and moves toward the door. As he does so:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring a lot of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie looks at the open bible, jaw hanging loose, his complexion ashen. Like he's just been slapped in the face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard brings a THICK SHEAF OF WRITING PAPER to the cafeteria table, sets it down by Lombardi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly am I writing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay close attention and write down every word exactly as I say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli removes his goggles. Solara can't believe what she se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes are pale, milky-white, dead. TOTALLY BLIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Book of Moses called Genesis. Chapter one, verse one. In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. Verse two. The earth was without form, and void; and darkness was on the face of the deep. And the spirit of God was hovering over the face of the waters. Verse three. And God said, "Let there be light," and there was light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lombardi hurriedly writes down every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie sits at his desk, still in shock. Eli's bible si open on the desk before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudia is ushered in by a guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes forward and thrusts the bible into her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me once that you know how to read this. This blind language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a long time ago, when I was a little girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to read it for me. Every word. And I'm going to write it down. Start at the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carnegie hunts on his desk for a paper and pen, Claudi opens the book and trails her fingertips across the raise lettering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment there is a glimmer of recognition... a faint smile... but then it fades as Carnegie turns back to her, eagerly clutching the writing materials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's been so long. I don't remember. I don't remember any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie is aghast. BEAT as the anger swells within him, threatening to explode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God fucking dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swipes violently at the bible, knocking it out of Claudia's hands. He grabs it up and tries to rip it in tw but it's too thick to tear. Red-faced with rage, he tosse out over the box balcony. It lands somewhere in the dark auditorium below, between the rows of gutted theater seat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he paces angrily back past Claudia:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, is there something-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go. Just get out of my sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slumps in his chair, exhausted and furious. Claudia sa turns and leaves him alone with his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some considerable time later. Great stacks of paper have filled with Lombardi's handwriting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lombardi's pen races across the paper, struggling to keep with Eli's recitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara is curled up on a nearby bench, asleep. Eli's coat covering her to keep her warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli clutches his wound painfully as he continues to recit He looks paler now than ever. Close to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Lord, thank you for giving me the strength and the conviction to complete the task you entrusted to me. Thank you for guiding me straight and true, through the many obstacles in my path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (V.O.) (cont'd) And for keeping me resolute when all around seemed lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prison yard shrouded in the dim light just before daw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solara crosses the yard. She looks more mature somehow. Determined and strong. She carries with her ELI'S SWORD - something else, tucked under her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your protection and for your many signs along the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops in a nondescript corner of the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At her feet is a SHALLOW MOUND OF DIRT. At the head of th mound, a SIMPLE TOMBSTONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels and places a SINGLE FLOWER on the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit only by the pale moonlight, barely enough to see by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie sleeps soundly in bed. Next to him lies Claudia, wide awake. She checks that Carnegie is sound asleep, car not to wake him before she creeps out of bed and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudia is on her hands and knees in the darkness, search blindly in the aisles and beneath the theater seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds Eli's bible in some litter strewn on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the good that I have done. For whatever light you were able to shine into the darkness of this world through me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the darkness, Claudia opens the book and runs fingers across the braille, reading. And though we can ba see in the dim light, we see the smile on her face. The j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Solara kneels by the grave, we see now that she wears Eli's SAINT CHRISTOPHER PENDANT around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tombstone reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unsheathes Eli's sword, plants it in the ground befor his grave. Takes the BOOK from under her arm and opens it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a NEW BIBLE. Crudely typeset from Lombardi's origina transcription and printed on the prison press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens it up and begins to read a passage from the bib over Eli's grave. We don't hear what she says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Solara finishes her reading and closes the bible, LOMB appears behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you don't have to leave. You're welcome to stay here with us. You'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, pulling Eli's sword from the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I gotta do what I gotta do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Solara looks at the sword, her fingers playing acro its hilt. The blade glimmers in the light of the rising s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a determined, purposeful look in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises through the fog on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great iron gates grind open. Solara emerges from insi the prison, steps out onto the island rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is dressed in a flak jacket, combat pants and boots. Eli's old pack across her back. Hair tied in a neat pony tail. Atop that, Eli's ragged fur hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the friend I made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her hand she clutches a copy of the newly-printed bibl Eli's sword slung over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please watch over her as you watched over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE as Solara walks back along Fisherman's Wharf... through the San Francisco rubble... across the Golden Gat bridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for allowing me finally to rest. I'm so very tired. The time of my departure is at hand and now I surrender my soul into your care, at peace in knowing that I have carried out your will. That I have done right with my time on this earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and finally back onto a desolate road leading off into desert wasteland. She looks up and down the road, then tu and heads toward the sun on the horizon. Headed east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have fought the good fight. I have finished the race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she walks away into the sun, her lonely silhouette on road reminds us of Eli as we saw him so many times before

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have kept the faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grows smaller and smaller as she walks into the dista until she consumed by the rising sun and we
